etymology.description: 斯(si) + 蒂(di) + 芬(fen) = transliteration of “Stephen.”
etymology.interpretation: A Mandarin transliteration of the English given name “Stephen,” chosen for sound rather than literal meaning. Characters are neutral-to-positive in sense, a common practice for foreign names.

parts.english: this; thus; such; used in transliteration
peduncle; fruit stem; flower base; calyx

examples.chinese: 我叫斯蒂芬(我叫斯蒂芬)。
斯蒂芬来自英国(斯蒂芬來自英國)。
斯蒂芬正在学习中文(斯蒂芬正在學習中文)。
